The Surrendered Witnessing
This is recently released content. If anything is out of order or you spot any errors, please let me know. I can be reached on discord (reqons). You can also ping me in the PMCH (Project Moon Community Hub) server. Please ping me in a spoiler channel or lore thread though. Thanksssssss -Dexian
Year: 985 - 01
Episode 1 - Episode 2 - Episode 3 - Episode 4 - Episode 5 - Episode 6 - Episode 7 - Episode 8 - Episode 9 - Episode 10 - Episode 11 - Episode 12 - Episode 13 - Episode 14 - Episode 15 - Episode 16 - Episode 17 - Episode 18 - Episode 19 - Episode 20 - Episode 21 - Episode 22 - Episode 23 - Episode 24 - Episode 25 - Episode 26 - Episode 27 - Episode 28 - Episode 29 - Episode 30 - Episode 31 - Episode 32 - Episode 33 - Episode 34 - Episode 35 - Episode 36 - Episode 37 - Episode 38 - Episode 39 - Episode 40 - Episode 41 - Episode 42 - Episode 43 - Episode 44 - Episode 45 - Episode 46 - Episode 47 - Episode 48 - Episode 49 - Episode 50 - Episode 51 - Episode 52 - Episode 53 - Episode 54 - Episode 55 - Episode 56 - Episode 57 - Episode 58
Episode: 1
Flowers wilt, petals fall, a drizzle of blossoms sky-blotting;
Colors fade, fragrance dies—but who shall mourn their passing?
To the garden I go, in hand a flower-rake,
Only to pace, lest crushed the scatter'd blossoms I make.
Thus, in this troubled world I breathe,
To shut my eyes
Is my sole reprieve.
Location: Daguanyuan Banquet Hall
Jia Mu Little Baoyu. You must have walked and toiled tirelessly on your journey home.
Hong Lu I wouldn’t say I suffered much, grandmother. My days were always filled with new and interesting things to see.
Ishmael Ugh… What are they talking about over there?
Ishmael They’re sitting so far apart that I can hardly hear them. I mean, is this even a dining ‘table’? I can’t even see who’s sitting at the other end from here.
Busy-looking Servant Is there anything bothering you, dear guests? If this humble servant can help with any—
Heathcliff Oh, there’s somethin’ bothering me alright. We’re in the middle of a meal, can you please stop—
Sinclair Noooope! Nope, not at all! Nothing’s bothering us at all…! Everything’s good.
Lady Wang Now… Baoyu, my boy. When will you introduce me to your new friends?
Gregor … Oh, boy. I never know how to act in front of others' parents… Where should I look? Is… this an appropriate size for a polite smile? I hope I don’t come off too smarmy—
Hong Lu Ha ha, it's nothing to fuss over. Think of this as your own place, and enjoy your time here~
Rodion Woohoo~ Thank ya!
Rodion … But whew, this place is soooo huge that I can hardly relax. I’m worried I might get lost going out for a cup of water.
Hong Lu Ah, don't you worry~ We have stray people shelters located all around the house for that. Our servants visit them once a month to collect anyone who’s unfortunately gotten lost. If they’re still alive, that is~
Sinclair Ha ha… Hong Lu, that has to be the funniest jo...ke you’ve ever told, ha ha ha...
Hong Lu Ha ha, I wasn’t joking, but I’m glad you enjoyed it anyway~
Yi Sang I must ask, Hong Lu, for I spy no other sibling of yours here; this is quite odd, for I had thought this to be a welcoming party for your return...
Jia Xichun Hey, it’s my welcoming party, too.
Jia Xichun Besides, what makes you think we’d ever want to see their stupid faces? Just to get mad?
Jia Xichun It’s been like ten whole years since we even shared a meal together.
Jia Xichun Oh, and… don’t even think about trying to chat me up. Did you already forget what I said earlier? There is nothing between us anymore. We're enemies.
Rodion Uh… did we initiate the conversation, though?
Lady Wang Oh, I am simply so glad that my son, Baoyu...
Lady Wang … has returned as a man who can now more than carry his own weight... And unharmed, too...
Lady Wang So, dear Baoyu…
Lady Wang I don’t mean to rush, but… when are you planning to depart again?
Hong Lu Nothing has been decided yet, mother.
Ishmael …….
Lady Wang I see… I-I am simply concerned that, were your stay here to be prolonged, perhaps you might fade before your duties are completed.
Lady Wang D-do you not also agree, venerable Jia Mu?
Jia Mu Indeed.
Jia Mu Dear Baoyu, our peerless treasure, tarry not overlong in this mundane world; leave when the time is right, and fulfill your worth.
Hong Lu …….
Hong Lu Okay, grandmother. Mother.
Throughout the entire familial discussion, Hong Lu's expression remained the same, in that tranquil, perpetual smile.
Despite his return after years of wandering being met with the family's obvious push to make him leave as soon as possible...
... he stands unaffected, as though he were expecting this gaudy yet hollow welcome.
Dante <…….>
With his attitude being so passive, I also had no choice but to watch as a bystander.
A few hours ago...
Location: Backstreets of District 8
Jia Xichun …….
Saude ... The palanquin'll be here soon.
Rodion ... A p-palanquin?! Woahh~ So cool! That sure sounds like a fancy ride! Isn’t that just super, Greg?!
Gregor Ooh! Yeah, Saude! Are we getting a palanquin or whatever it's called to give us a ride all the way to the m-mansion?!
The usual comedy pair’s desperate efforts to lighten the mood are particularly appreciated today, as tragically ineffective as they seem to be.
Saude Yes. The LCB and Jia Xichun will be heading to Grand View Garden Daguanyuan where one of the most prominent families of H Corp. reside.
Dante <If they’ve sent a whole palanquin to pick us up… huh, does Hong Lu’s family already know that he’ll be participating in the Family Hierarch war?>
Faust No, it is unlikely that they are aware. After all, it can be assumed that the most likely reason that the company waited until the last minute to relay us this order was to minimize the chance of information leakage.
Faust Therefore, it would be correct to presume that the palanquin is here merely as a gesture of welcome for Hong Lu and Jia Xichun's return.
Saude Which means that only the invited—Hong Lu, Jia Xichun, and their ‘factions’ can ride the palanquin to Daguanyuan.
Saude Unfortunately, this means the LCCB, Vergilius, and Charon won’t be able to join you on this journey.
Hong Lu That’s too bad. It would’ve been nice if we could all go there together.
Jia Xichun … Just as petty as I expected from the seniors of our family. Would it kill them to house a handful more people in that humongous park of a house? It’s not like they’d notice the difference.
Saude Oh my, how touching. Looks like miss Jia Xichun thinks she’ll miss us too.
Jia Xichun What a thing to say to my face after that shameless backstabbing.
Saude Ahaha...
Jia Xichun I mean, do any of you even comprehend what it means to participate in the Family Hierarch war?
Hong Lu …….
Jia Xichun Do you even understand why we call it a ‘war’ when the official name for it is an ‘evaluation’?
Jia Xichun You’re risking your lives by getting involved in this. Once you get in there, you'll be stalked at every turn by people looking to kill you.
Jia Xichun Including me.
Dante <…….>
Jia Xichun Remember how Wei saved your life back at that fake kezhan? Now imagine the same scenario, except this time, it could be Wei who's there to kill you.
Wei I must say ahead of time that this is a truly regrettable turn of events. I did not wish to have to fight any of you, but…
Wei looked at us with an unfamiliar and cold, intense glare.
Sinclair W-well, we feel… very much the same way, so… Looks like we’re on the same page there… ha… ha ha...
Jia Xichun This means that I'm also fair game. You could stab me in the back again, literally, this time.
Sinclair Uh… no, never. I wouldn't even dream of doing something like—
Jia Xichun ignored Sinclair’s anxious pleas and looked straight toward Hong Lu.
Jia Xichun This... could be the last chance to change your mind, brother.
Jia Xichun I didn’t invite you to join my faction with a light heart.
Jia Xichun Besides, it’s the Family Hierarch war. This isn’t something you can just flippantly decide that you wanna particip—
Hong Lu I know the life you've lived, Xichun.
Hong Lu I also grew up hearing those countless tales about the Family Hierarch war, just as you did.
Hong Lu So the weight we’re feeling must be the same.
Jia Xichun …….
Jia Xichun Right. So this is where our tenuous alliance really ends.
Jia Xichun Well, not like I care. It did drag on a little too long for a temporary alliance forged out of convenience.
Jia Xichun … We’re just going back to how things used to be, that's all.
Jia Xichun And that's fine by me. I think that's enough chit-chat with you, then.
Hong Lu Okay. If that's what you want.
Hong Lu ... Oh, Xichun.
Jia Xichun ... What.
Hong Lu ... Please don't tell the family that I'll be participating, will you?
Hong Lu I was told to keep this a secret for now.
Jia Xichun ... Hah.
Jia Xichun Tell me one reason I should do you that favor now.
For someone who supposedly doesn’t care, Xichun appeared rather hurt as she took a moment to glare at Hong Lu, biting her lower lip…
Jia Xichun …….
... then suddenly strode right up to him.
Dante <…!>
Jia Xichun Is this even your call, brother?
Jia Xichun Or are you just following their orders?
Jia Xichun gestured toward the rest of us with her chin.
Hong Lu Mm... my participation in the Family Hierarch war is already decided. If you're still curious to know why, then...
Hong Lu Xichun, do you believe that my choices carry any significant meaning?
Jia Xichun … Oh, I see what's up. This crap again.
Jia Xichun So you already know what participating in the war means, but you just have no idea why I'd ever ask you something like that, huh?
Jia Xichun Fine, looks like I don't even need to hear your reply. There’s no point in trying with you anymore.
Jia Xichun At least I’ll have fun watching how far you get with that shallow, meaningless attitude of yours.
Dante <Hey, wait…>
Jia Xichun appeared pretty distressed after that exchange, so I was about to say something—when Pilot, who had been fiddling with the radio behind Saude, began shouting urgently.
Pilot Woah! Manager Saude! A palanquin's been seen coming this way!
Rodion Ugh… I’d like to chill a bit today, yesterday was too tough. Let’s head on over so we can at least relax on the way there—
Jia Xichun Nope, we’re taking this one.
Jia Xichun You never think twice about giving things up to others anyway, do you, brother?
Rodion Huh? What the heck do ya mean? C’mon, let’s do this fair and square with, like, uh… rock, paper, and scissors?
Jia Xichun Wooow, sure. Why not decide the next Hierarch with a game of rock, paper, and scissors, too? How’s that?
Jia Xichun gave us a wry grin before leaving. Wei followed her wordlessly.
Gregor Boy… and I thought we were finally making some friends out here.
Stranger Look! Over there, there's a group waiting for a palanquin! One of ‘em must be the candidate the client told us about!
Sinclair E-everyone, there's a group of hostile-looking people coming our way...
Outis Shi Yihua is unlikely to be the only one who's going after the other candidates… Executive Manager, we best take care of them before the next palanquin arrives.
Dante <… Yeah. What can we do, right?>
Episode: 2
Location: Backstreets of District 8
Outis No more signs of enemy reinforcements, Executive Manager.
Sinclair Phew… at least there’s an end to them this time. The guys that attacked us when we first got here were endless.
Ishmael Well, that's because we walked right into a trap then. Shallow, but still.
Sinclair Anyways… Xichun appeared pretty hurt by that, didn’t she…
Rodion Honestly, though… I get why she feels so betrayed.
Rodion Remember all those stories about Hong Lu’s family we heard? Imagine you're one of their kids, thinking that you finally found like, a potential ally in your family… only for him to pretty much stab ya in the back last minute.
Saude Yeah, right? It was really awkward for me too, even though I wasn’t exactly involved.
Saude chimed in nonchalantly as though it wasn't her who pulled the plug on our alliance at the last second.
Ishmael Anyways…
Ishmael Where’s our escort? I can’t imagine that H Corp. can’t afford to send us guards with the palanquin.
Saude If this family loved each other enough to send escorts for their safety, I doubt they’d be holding a cutthroat ceremony like the Family Hierarch Evaluations.
Saude It’s a world where might makes right, where the strong prey on the weak…
Saude People won’t bat an eye even if one of the dozens of candidates is found dead in some ditch on the road.
Hong Lu …….
Saude Oh. Sorry, Hong Lu. I must’ve been running my mouth again without thinking about how that sounds.
Saude Someone usually stopped me before I got too far...
Hong Lu Don’t worry. You didn’t say anything wrong.
Hong Lu It took me a while to realize that other families weren’t like this, but…
Hong Lu … there is no reason to be upset by the way things are.
Episode: 3
Location: Backstreets of District 8
Dante <Hm? What’s that ominous metallic noise…?>
Yi Sang The tolling of bells… Bells with the resonance unlike that of any other, normally marked by their clarity.
Yi Sang This bell is muddled, as if it tolls for ill-fortune on the horizon...
Hong Lu Wow~ That bell sure is a resounding reminder that I'm home again~
Hong Lu It's the bell that tolls every once a while. You can hear its resonance from anywhere in Hongyuan.
Saude …….
Saude It’s restructuring day(再積日).
Ishmael Huh? But the restructuring day already—
She trails off, unable to finish her sentence as a brutal scene unfolds behind us.
Ishmael Whoa… are you guys seeing this?
Ishmael The buildings are all… starting to shift…
It was as Ishmael said; the buildings, all tethered to a complicated network of rails, were either rising from or sinking into the earth.
Meursault Movement has been observed from every building in the vicinity. Everything is changing.
Yi Sang The localized shifting of structures we had observed yesternight were... not as sweeping as this.
Saude What you saw last night must’ve been a premonition of the restructuring day, nudging some buildings to their positions for a smoother overall redistribution of space.
Saude Now this… this is the real deal.
Ishmael Huh… that whole mess was just a premonition?
Saude It's a remnant of an old H Corp. that was here long, long before the current Hongyuan. This structure has been here for a while, so we can't quite know the nature or the purpose of its Singularity, but at this moment…
Saude … they shift based on current H Corp.’s restructuring standards.
♬The world's assembly shifts overnight♬
♬Yet those who toiled and toiled have naught to fear♬
♬Is it not joyous, to have a place to rest your feet tonight♬
♬To those who weren't availed of fortune, this is simply the reality to bear♬
♬Only choice is to retreat in silence, to accept your fate as one might♬
♬Await the coming month, ponder how one might save their skin♬
♬How many shall plummet today, and how many shall remain?♬
♬Hold on not to all things too tight♬
♬For you may lose sight of when to let go, and feign ignorance when you must take flight♬
Yi Sang The consequence of re-assembly for the evicted is an endless plummet...
Yi Sang What a terribly distressing sight to behold, unable to do aught to help.
Sinclair Is this… another one of H Corp.’s idiosyncrasies?
Saude Hm, I don't know. Didn't other nests also have their own measures of one's wealth?
Yi Sang Mm... As T Corp. makes use of time as currency?
Saude Exactly. H Corp.'s measure of wealth and currency is based on how much space a person owns, measured by a scale they call 'rooms'.
Yi Sang Id est: the measure of one's space is the measure of one's wealth.
Saude Exactly. So once every month, the worth of each person’s labor and the quantity of their income are measured to determine how much space they are assigned.
Gregor So they can just kick me out of my home for no reason...?
Gregor What the... Just what kind of ridiculous rule is that...?
Saude Well, it might appear that way to outsiders like us, but…
Saude … the calculations behind these redistributions are meticulously designed and have been here for a long time, so it seems to me that everyone just accepts them as a natural part of their lives.
Sinclair Have you seen this happen... in person too, Hong Lu?
Sinclair This ‘restructuring day’...
Hong Lu … I have.
Hong Lu Sometimes, I’d watch the cityscape from behind the railings of my room.
Hong Lu It happened far, far away from me, but I could see it all very well.
His expression remains tranquil and still as he calmly reminisces.
It was like then, when he was merely watching the featureless scenery pass him by.
Hong Lu Daguanyuan, my old home, was never too concerned about the restructuring days. We’d get more rooms some days, but we’d never, ever shrink.
Hong Lu So I've never been affected by these restructuring days. I only ever witnessed them as they happened beneath me, high-up in my room.
Heathcliff You, you’re… hah, fine. I doubt there was anything you could’ve done, but…
Heathcliff … You just sat on your hands and watched all this shite—
... Heathcliff trailed off, but I could see that he was gritting his teeth.
Pilot Ah! Another palanquin’s coming!
Saude And there's your ride. I think we’ve chatted enough, so let’s get you guys going.
Ishmael ... This is a palanquin?
Saude Yep. Looks like they sent us a palanquin large enough to comfortably seat a big crowd of people together~
Palanquin Bearer Young master Jia Baoyu and his twelve honored guests, is that correct?
Saude Mm~ it's thirteen, to be exact?
Dante <... Uh, but I thought Saude wasn't invited?>
Palanquin Bearer Woah, woah, hold your horses. I was told that young master Baoyu’s faction was just twelve people?
Upon hearing that, Saude began aggressively striding toward him, causing the palanquin bearer to shrink in fear.
Palanquin Bearer W-woah, slow down, lady…
Saude We are twelve people, what’s wrong?
Saude I mean, don't tell me this thing looks like a normal, contributing member of a clan to you?
Dante <Whuh?>
Saude suddenly grabbed my shoulders and presented me before the bearer like I was some product.
Palanquin Bearer Uh… I mean, that’s a pretty unique head this one's got there, don’t think I’ve seen anything like it ‘round here in Hongyuan... but isn’t that just a prosthetic? In the shape of a… clock, I guess, but still…
Saude I mean, let me ask you something. Can you imagine why anyone in their right mind would stick a clock where their head’s gotta go? Even if they were hurting for cash?
Palanquin Bearer Aw, no way, ma’am. Never. There are way more versatile bio-modifications available here in Hongyuan than… whatever that hack-job is. Nobody in their right mind would.
Saude Exactly, right? No idea what went down, but this fellow here sure seems to have fallen on hard times. Too bad we live in a world where such misfortune can befall an honest soul like them.
Palanquin Bearer Boy, oh boy… looks like this one’s got scammed. A nasty scam, too—whatever Backstreets they got that from, musta been a real scoundrel who did it. Tsk, tsk...
Saude And look, even the clock isn’t on time, and this poor person is barely conscious! Look, all they can do is make these weird ticking noises because they don’t even have a mouth!
... Those were some pretty darn hurtful things to say, but I decided not to take them at face value. It was pretty obvious what she was trying to do.
Dante <Somebody... tell Saude... I'm getting dizzy...>
Palanquin Bearer Good grief! You weren't kiddin'... who coulda done something so awful...?
Saude It's a real blessing that young master Baoyu's got such a kindhearted soul. He simply could not walk past the timepiece emporium selling this human being like they're some toy or a tool, so he picked them up to get their head replaced with something proper. Hongyuan's got more than enough resources for something like that, right?
Palanquin Bearer Oh, well, you're not wrong there... It's really easy to swap out your whole body as long as you've got the cash to burn...
Dante <Wha…? A new head? For me?>
Saude Right? See what I mean? So that’s why they told you that young master Baoyu only has twelve people in his faction. Including yours truly.
Palanquin Bearer W-well, I see your point. But we can't just—
Saude —let all of us board, yes. Our young master fully understands the moral conundrum you find yourself in. So we'd like to offer you this tiny, tiny token of appreciation...
Saude produced some bills from her pocket and smoothly slid them into the palanquin bearer's own.
Palanquin Bearer Aw man, aw, lady, you really shouldn’t do this… I really shouldn't...
Saude Oh, and another thing. I'm sure I don't need to tell you this, but... if a word of this gets out, things might get pretty messy for both of us. And that doesn't have to happen, does it?
Palanquin Bearer Ahem. Indubitably, ma'am. I’m doing this purely out of the goodness of my heart, after all! What’s a free ride for the downtrodden, eh?
Heathcliff Seems to me the bloke’s doin’ this purely out of interest in the fatness of his wallet...
Saude Alright, alright. Stop gossiping over there and get on board.
Dante <Wait, wait... are we leaving Pilot alone here?>
Pilot seemed to have noticed me staring in his direction. He stopped fidgeting with a radio and waved at us.
Pilot Ah! Don't you worry about me, and have a safe trip over there! I've got some stuff to handle on the outside!
Location: Palanquin Interior
Yi Sang This design is more akin to an... extravagant limousine than a palanquin.
Rodion Oh look, a bottle of champagne... can I chug this?!
Outis Of course not! Drinking while on a mission is—
Saude Okay.
With a quick clap, Saude promptly put an end to the hubbub the unexpectedly flashy appearance of the palanquin caused.
Her demeanor had shifted entirely into that of a calm and collected strategist, a far cry from the person who was chatting up a storm with the bearer just a minute ago...
Saude Time to get to work, everyone.
Episode: 4
Location: Palanquin Interior
Saude Then, you'll—
Outis Wait.
Outis Something's going on outside.
Not long after Saude paused over Outis's remark, a grating speaker whine rang out, followed by the worried voice of the bearer on the other end.
Palanquin Bearer W-we're under attack!
Saude Mm~ I thought things were going a little too easy. It's no surprise that other candidates are trying to eliminate us just in case.
Dante <... Why am I not surprised?>
Episode: 5
Location: Palanquin Interior
Palanquin Bearer Entering Daguanyuan now!
Despite some troubles on the way, it seemed that we managed to arrive at our destination mostly unhurt.
Hong Lu …….
Daguanyuan, Hong Lu's old home.
Saude Oof, we’re running out of time.
Saude Faust, I'm sure you understood the most important part of my plan, right?
Faust …….
Faust It is... unlikely to be a pleasant sight to behold.
Saude Remember, the plan hinges on your patience, everyone. You have to remain calm and wait, even if they freak out and actively try to kill you.
Faust There is a chance that they might panic and immediately order for the Sinners to be executed on the spot. However, it is unlikely that the person whose responsibility is to judge the next Family Hierarch of Hongyuan will make such a hasty response.
Saude Exactly. Everything's going to be fine as long as the decider has the capacity for patience.
Heathcliff Nnh? Execution? Wha?
Saude Great. I'll follow up with a subsequent contact once you've safely completed the first round of the evaluations.
After that cryptic exchange with Faust, Saude leaped gracefully off the moving palanquin as Heathcliff murmured in his half-sleep.
We watched her grow smaller and smaller as the distance between us grew, but what really caught our eyes were the scattered humans that the restructuring day had evicted from their homes. They were trying to drag their broken bodies off the road, sobbing and writhing.
Sinclair This… is horrible. There isn’t anything we can do to help, but...
Meursault Such sense of futility and powerlessness will negatively impact the efficient performance of your professional obligations.
Meursault Repeated exposure to similar stimuli is recommended to desensitize oneself to this sensation.
Sinclair …….
Sinclair S-so Hong Lu, how do you feel about going back home after so long?
Sinclair changed the subject.
Hong Lu Hmm… I don’t know...
Heathcliff Don’t even need to ask him, lad. I know it can’t be easy.
Heathcliff As for me... blimey, I hesitated almost a thousand times, wonderin' if I should just turn around and leave.
Heathcliff What if I knocked on those gates, but she, she—
Heathcliff …….
Heathcliff came to a suffocating stop, his voice trembling lightly as he did so.
The other Sinners stared at him in confused silence.
Ishmael What, what is it? Why’d you stop in the middle of a—
Dante <Um… wow, look at these cool windows. I think we can swap them out with other images!>
Ishmael Sigh...
I quickly tried to swerve from this subject again, but all I got was Ishmael’s scolding glare that seemed to wordlessly tell me “not the time!”.
Hong Lu Fuhu, I remember.
Hong Lu I remember what happened each time one of us returned to the part of the City that held our memories. Memories of happiness... anger... sorrow... and joy. And as we traveled, I remember that they were all looking at sceneries only they could see.
Hong Lu Rodya, you awkwardly tried your best to crack jokes.
Hong Lu Sinclair, you tried your best to hold back the welling tears, again and again.
Hong Lu Yi Sang, you shut your eyes for a long, long time.
Hong Lu Ishmael, you couldn’t stop talking to yourself while glaring down at the lake’s surface.
Hong Lu And Heathcliff, I saw you scared and anxious, shaping your hair over and over again.
Dante <You've really been... watching us closely, huh.>
Rodion Did... we?
Hong Lu Spring leaves, petals scatter, and all shall turn around to find the doors to which they belong and return forevermore.
Hong Lu I think everyone has a small mound of petals they gathered for themselves.
Heathcliff ... What? I don't. Why would anyone collect somethin' like that?
Hong Lu Then you simply haven't discarded them yet.
There was still a transparent smile on his face, but I think I saw a burying, sinking shadow behind it.
Location: -1
Dante <Oh...>
The moment I felt that, a familiar light came into view.
And I immediately understood what was going on.
The Golden Bough is close, and it is resonating with Hong Lu's fathoms.
??? They watch the flower-burial of mine and mock away
Location: Somewhere in Daguanyuan, Past
??? Who lays me to rest once I die?
??? When spring passes, youth passes, as wrinkles shear it all away
??? Flowers pass, people pass, and ignorant they remain to where they hie.
Hong Lu Why do you always recite these strange, complicated poems, Daiyu?
Hong Lu There are plenty of ways to remain young, aren't there?
Daiyu? Because we needn't see the snow in our hair to know that spring will pass.
Hong Lu Why are you cleaning up those fallen petals?
Hong Lu Just float them away downstream. You'll get dirt on your hands...
Daiyu? And be so wasteful?
Daiyu? How will we hear the sound of falling rain once we sweep all the petals away?
Daiyu? This is a remembrance. Remembrance of a rainy day. So I'm gonna treasure it.
Daiyu? Besides, these beautiful blossoms'll get so dirty in the stream if we let them float away.
Daiyu? So please, don't scatter all the petals from your embrace, big bro Baoyu.
Location: Palanquin Interior
Dante <Hong Lu...>
Dante <Is there anyone you miss here at Daguanyuan?>
Hong Lu Hmm…
Hong Lu No, there isn't.
Sinclair … But how's that possible? Isn’t your family there…? And… a bunch of other people who are so important to you…?
Yi Sang …….
Hong Lu Well, as long as I believe them to be doing well…
Hong Lu … there isn’t any need for me to yearn to see them again.
Dante <……. >
Dante <Do you still... treasure your petals?>
Hong Lu No. I scattered them all the day I departed my home.
Hong Lu So my rainy days are now silent.
Dante <I see... >
Hong Lu You saw that, didn't you? Dante.
Hong Lu You saw my memory.
Dante <... I did.>
Hong Lu Hehe.
Hong Lu laughed. He wasn't surprised or angry that I peered into his memories.
Sinclair Uhm...
Sinclair Do you want to tell us about your parents? Or, uh… yeah, you talked about your grandmother pretty often, right? What kind of people are they... ?
Sinclair added carefully.
Maybe he was trying to commiserate, tenuous as that connection might've been. We were headed to his home to meet his family, anyway.
Hong Lu Ah, they are both very wise in the ways of the world.
Hong Lu Grandmother always treated me preciously.
Hong Lu So did my mother, and my father.
Sinclair Uh, uhm...
Hong Lu Ah, we're almost there.
Hong Lu I can see the garden.
Dante <This is one massive garden...>
Hong Lu We still have some time before we get to the main buildings.
Hong Lu I remember the days when deer and hares would frolic out here in the garden, fuhu.
Ishmael Well, I can see myself taking a long walk around here. It’d take a whole day and then some to cover the entire ground...
Hong Lu I usually lingered only around my own room. It’s dangerous to stray too far, after all.
Dante <It’s dangerous? Why?>
Hong Lu There's the stranger danger, getting lost, getting targeted... Besides, it's very dark at night.
Heathcliff Well, that ain’t a very big deal, is it? Kids run around, scrape their faces on the branches, trip and eat shite on the pavement all the time.
Hong Lu Hehe, I’m sure you would’ve run freely around the garden, Heathcliff. But it's important to always be careful.
Hong Lu When I was five, someone had lathered a deadly poison on a random tree branch.
Rodion Ack... poison?!
Hong Lu I had a little brother who liked to frolic like you do, Heathcliff.
Hong Lu But by some coincidence, he happened to be running around the same tree that had its branches lathered with poison.
Don Quixote What… what hath transpired thereafter?
Hong Lu I'm sure he got better.
Hong Lu Xiren told me he’ll be just fine after a hundred nights' rest.
Hong Lu And because Xiren was always so smart, I'm sure it happened exactly as she said.
Episode: 6
Location: Palanquin Interior
Palanquin Bearer Entering Grand Flower HallDahuating (大花廳) now!
It wasn't long before our arrival to a new place within Daguanyuan was made known by the palanquin bearer's sonorous announcement.
Heathcliff More buildings...? What's Dahuating mean, anyway?
Hong Lu Mmm~ Grand Flower Hall, so I think you could call it a place for banquets?
Gregor Huh... So you host banquets in this... village-sized 'venue'...?
Sinclair I-is that a lake over there?
Hong Lu Nope, it's a pond~
Gregor A p-pond...? Daaamn...
Hong Lu Once we arrive, we will find ourselves a welcoming party for Xichun and me.
Hong Lu Aha! Rodya, you should be able to stuff yourself to your heart's content this time. It's been a while, hasn’t it~?
Rodion I don’t think I’ve been this excited in a long time…
Ishmael Whoa... Is that a ship over there? You have a ship?
Hong Lu Aha, yep~ We'd sometimes go out boating.
Hong Lu Oh, and Xichun's building is right across that pond!
Dante <You each get a building of your own?>
Hong Lu Yes, we do. So when I first departed from Hongyuan, I found the concept of an entire family living under the same roof so fascinating.
Don Quixote Alas… ‘twould be quite the challenge for thy family to see one another.
Hong Lu And that's exactly why we each get a building.
Ishmael ... Are we even talking about the same thing here?
Don Quixote Alack for woe! We could have merrily enjoyed our vacaciones at young Hong Lu’s residence all along?!
Hong Lu That wouldn’t have worked, Don Quixote. When I left home, grandmother and the elders really impressed upon me that...
Hong Lu ... "The footsteps shall eventually bring you home when the time is right; thus, witness, and only witness, as much of the world as you may before you make your return."
Hong Lu ... I was wondering when that would be… but time really slipped through our fingers, and just like that... it brought me here.
Most Sinners did not welcome their turn. Some of them were even terrified of it.
Sometimes, they had to confront what they'd been avoiding all their lives.
And for some, important things that were once forgotten or lost were waiting for their return.
But their reluctance is really not surprising at all.
I don't think I'd welcome an opportunity to get my memories back with open arms if it was thrust upon me out of nowhere, especially if I was getting dragged there against my will.
But despite the fact that it couldn't be more obvious that his turn had arrived, Hong Lu was as tranquil as he always was.
He's always been able to remain aloof no matter what happens. Maybe it won’t be different this time, either.
But even so... can I judge that so hastily?
Palanquin Bearer Young Master Baoyu of the Jia family has returned!
Again, with the palanquin bearer's deep, full-throated pronouncement of our arrival, the door opened.
Hong Lu Here we are. You must all be so tired! Come in, come in~
Leaving behind the Sinners, who were still reeling from the astronomical level of opulence at display, Hong Lu bounced lightly off the palanquin and moseyed into the building.
Yi Sang Jia Quite the…
Yi Sang ... lightfooted steps he take, unhindered by excitement nor trepidation…
Sinclair Right...?
Heathcliff Rich boy’s got nothin’ to fear 'cos he’s used to this kind of poshness, that’s all this is.
Don Quixote Verily, this may be a subtle expression of that teensy part of him that longeth to see his family again!
Once we all left the palanquin...
Location: Daguanyuan - Dahuating Banquet Hall
Yi Sang I find myself beset by overwhelming vastitudes and objects of great magnitude...
Ishmael Just how many servants do they have…?
Hong Lu Ah, grandmother will visit us once Xu hour(戌時) arrives.
Hong Lu The banquet will start then, I think.
Dante <'Xu hour'...?>
Faust The ‘Xu hour’ refers to the time between 19:00 and 21:00. This is a unique time system used in certain regions of the east.
Faust In addition...
Faust ... it would be best to remember that Hong Lu's grandmother, Jia Mu, is the Hierarch of Daguanyuan. It would not be an incorrect assessment to see her as the ruler of Hongyuan.
Outis Your relative is... the head of a Wing, I see.
Hong Lu Yes. Though she'll be handing that over to the next heir pretty soon.
Outis Why now? What does she seek to achieve by abdicating at this precise time?
Outis, as she probably saw an ulterior motive behind every move, inquired.
Hong Lu She's been saying that her time would eventually come, that she's carried this responsibility for too long.
Ishmael I bet she’d be pretty shocked to hear that you’ll be taking part in the Family Hierarch war.
Hong Lu Hehe, I don't know about that. Maybe she'll take it well.
Hong Lu There's never been a reason for me to bother participating, but... there wasn't a reason for me to not, either.
Dante <…….>
Sinclair Huh? Hey, there’s Xichun and Wei over there. Looks like they both arrived safely.
Jia Xichun, who arrived before us, shot us the briefest glance… before looking away with exaggerated disinterest.
Sinclair X-Xichun just turned her back on us…
Ishmael Well, didn’t take long for things to become super awkward…
Don Quixote Oo, we must capture this opportunity to seat ourselves adjacent to young Xichun!
Gregor Too late... We are forever banned from ever getting anywhere near her...
Don Quixote Yet wherefore...?
Faust We are no longer Jia Xichun's faction.
Faust Her hostility is to be expected.
Meursault Things have changed.
Meursault Us versus them. In-group versus out-group.
Outis Deception and treachery are natural parts of war.
Outis An ally of today may as well become an enemy tomorrow…
Ishmael And that’s a funny way to say “I don't have any friends”...
Outis What did you just—
Hong Lu Ah, there are my parents.
Heathcliff H-hold on, we’re just walkin’ right up to ‘em? Blimey, at least tell us their names!
Hong Lu Aha. Father's name is Zheng of the Jia family. And in Daguanyuan, they call my mother Lady Wang.
Hong Lu I greet you for the first time since my departure.
Location: Daguanyuan - Dahuating Banquet Hall
Jia Zheng …….
Hong Lu Baoyu of the Jia family has returned home.
Jia Zheng ... You're early.
Lady Wang Bao… Dear Baoyu… it has been too many years…
Lady Wang To see you again after so long, I... it is so good to see your face.
Lady Wang Oh… I don’t know what I should even say…
The father, Jia Zheng's eyes dart nervously between us and Hong Lu.
Meanwhile, his mother gingerly brings him in for a careful embrace as though she was in the presence of something so utterly, deeply moving. It was... more than the pure joy of reunion.
So they're Hong Lu's parents...
Hong Lu Thank you so much for your hospitality. You have certainly spared no expenses.
Lady Wang So… who are these people you've come here with…?
Hong Lu While there aren’t too many of them, they are my friends I made out in the world.
Ishmael ... At least he’s not introducing us as his 'lackeys' like a certain someone I know.
Heathcliff Oi, that's—! Agh… ahem.
Hong Lu’s mother slowly turns around to look at us.
I mean, it’s a weird thing to say, but…
… somehow, it almost felt like she was looking down at each of us, one by one.
Lady Wang I am so glad to meet you all. Baoyu’s always been such a stubborn child… I’m sure he was quite the handful to accompany you on your journeys. I hope you can still embrace him despite every—
Ishmael Stubborn? Hong Lu?
Jia Zheng Hmmmh...
Lady Wang …….
Whatever it was she said, they don't seem all too happy to hear that...
Lady Wang Dear Baoyu…
Lady Wang Why do you allow your friends to call you by that name? What of your noble, blessed name, bestowed upon you by the revered Xianren, our elders...?
Heathcliff What? What’s goin’ on with her…?
Hong Lu reached out and, gently yet indifferently, held his mother’s violently trembling hands.
Hong Lu Of course I would, mother.
Hong Lu Because the name is too noble indeed.
Lady Wang Oh...! Ah, ah. Yes. It is not a name that any rabble should so heedlessly speak…
Lady Wang Of course, of course…
Gregor Oh, do you also have an old name and a new name?
Rodion Well, don’tcha remember~? Back in P Corp., Wei called Hong Lu ‘young master Baoyu’.
Ishmael Also, remember how he announced himself before that duel on the day we arrived at H Corp.? He introduced himself as 'Baoyu of the Jia family'. I thought it was a pseudonym back then though, given the circumstances.
Heathcliff Well... it ain't like us callin' your real name's gonna cheapen its 'nobility', or whatever... tsk.
Hong Lu Hehe, it’s just a name, so you can say it as many times as you want and it won't depreciate in whatever value it has. Oh, but some people do actually believe that it does, I suppose.
Jia Zheng It was… wise of you to refrain from using that name.
Lady Wang Right, right. To let your precious name be known among the plebeian populace is to encourage knives in the dark to strike. Even here, too...
Faust It is as your mother says. Were your true name to be made known, any individual with a passing connection to H Corp. would have easily connected you to Hongyuan.
Yi Sang It is said that most names are repositories of their keepers' origins.
Yi Sang In the eastern region of the City, when the parents name their children, they imbue them with meaning; it carries their wish for their children's place and use in the world.
Ryoshu … You. What’s your name mean?
Hong Lu My name… My name is a culmination of wishes, not only those of my parents, but those of many more.
Hong Lu It means that I was born with a precious jade.
Ishmael Jia Baoyu…
Ryoshu Tsk, awful. Hong Lu’s better.
Sinclair <size=80%>At least try to whisper!</size>
Heathcliff Eugh, I’ll call the rich boy however I want to. If I'm ever forced to call 'im ‘young master Baoyu~’ or some servile shite like that, I’d rather take a punch or two from the guide.
I could feel the horrified gaze of the servants staring at us.
Hong Lu Hehe. I don’t mind, so please continue to call me Hong Lu if you want.
Befined Servant Please seat yourselves, honored guests. The food will be served soon.
Heathcliff Oi... what's all this?
Ishmael Do they actually expect us to eat all this?
Dante <... I don’t think I’ve ever been intimidated by food before.>
There was, quite literally, a mountain of dishes on the table—I was starting to wonder if the purpose of these dishes was more to flaunt their wealth than to feed us a reasonable amount of food.
Rodion What a feast! I can ask for re... refills, right? Ehehe...
Befined Servant Huh? Um, yes...
Dante <Anyway, what's up with those empty seats over there? Are we still killing time for some guests to arrive...?>
Hong Lu Mm…
Hong Lu I don’t think so. They’re probably seats for my older siblings somewhere in Daguanyuan. They probably just didn’t want to attend.
Hong Lu This is a banquet to welcome me, after all. I’m sure they believe it’s a waste of time to attend.
Gregor Man, they better be on some real busy schedule to miss this…
Befined Servant Jia Mu, venerated be her presence, graces us!
Beticent Servant Jia Mu, venerated be her presence, graces us!
With the announcement, utter silence quickly devoured the busy hubbub of the banquet...
Those who were sitting quickly rose to their feet and bowed, while those who were standing knelt down on all fours, their backs bent so low that their foreheads were nearly touching the floor.
And the woman walking out from between them, the crowd itself parting down the middle from her sheer presence...
Hong Lu Oh, there's grandmother.
... was Hong Lu's grandmother, the Family Hierarch of H Corp., and its Chief Executive Director.
Jia Mu's presence was at once warm, gentle, yet immense and overwhelming, like a personification of an insurmountable mountain.
Crowd We are graced by your presence, venerable Jia Mu.
Lady Wang We are graced by your presence, venerable Jia Mu.
Rodion W-whuh? Should we bow, too?
Gregor I don’t think you could bow any lower with your face halfway in the bowl, so you should be fine... probably...?
Sinclair S-she’s surrounded by Heishou too, I think.
Dante <Guys, everything’s gonna be fine as long as we don’t do anything stupid…>
As everyone was bowing before Jia Mu, awed and humbled...
... only Hong Lu looked straight at Jia Mu without bowing.
Then, he got up from his seat and walked toward her.
Hong Lu It has been a while, grandmother.
Jia Mu's Servant Please ascend, young master Baoyu.
It seemed that a special permission was needed to even stand next to her, as Hong Lu was allowed to approach her only after the servant gave him the go ahead.
Jia Mu Little Baoyu.
Jia Mu You must have walked and toiled tirelessly on your journey home.
Hong Lu Not at all, grandmother. I was able to learn so many new things, thanks to everyone who treated me so nicely.
Jia Mu Had you sought to master the art of learning, no master, regardless of pursuit, would have been out of our reach; you could have learned much in the halls of erudition from them.
Jia Mu Yet the world taught from sheets of paper are simply that—words on paper.
Jia Mu We wished that you, dear Baoyu, would learn more of the secular world, to not let flow betwixt your fingers the time that is given to you.
Hong Lu I know this opportunity was more than what I deserved, grandmother.
Jia Mu I appreciate your return all the same, that you have deigned to return before me ere my abdication of the great responsibility.
Don Quixote Verily, it appeareth that young Hong Lew shigned onto Limbews Chompany ash a gran churismo of shorts! Mmhm.
Rodion Gran chewrismo? Whash' shaat?
Outis … Can the two of you stop babbling with your mouths full?
Don Quixote Young masters of families moooooost eminent are oft sent out to the world on a grand tour—thus coined was this practice 'gran turismo', if thou wilt—afore they are to commence their public activities!
Meursault Mm. The purpose is to learn the varied experiences that cannot be gained from books, to grow familiar with the world outside.
Jia Mu I hear that you have met with Xichun in the world not long ago?
Hong Lu I have.
Jia Mu A bright child, she is. Well-prepared to take on the challenges of the Family Hierarch Evaluations, I presume.
Hong Lu I agree. I am sure Xichun will wisely overcome the trials.
Jia Mu Indeed.
Jia Mu Have you paid visit to the revered elders, then?
Hong Lu ... I will, soon.
Jia Mu Lady Wang, ascend here as well.
Lady Wang With your mercy, Jia Mu, of course...
Hong Lu’s mother hurried up to where Jia Mu stood.
Jia Mu It must cause your heart great distress to have your one and only son depart his home, to wander the world beyond the hedges.
Lady Wang O-of course not, Jia Mu…
Lady Wang Oh, I am simply so glad that my son, Baoyu...
Lady Wang … has returned as a man who can now more than carry his own weight... And unharmed, too...
Lady Wang Thus, dear Baoyu…
Lady Wang I don’t mean to rush, but… when are you planning to depart again?
Hong Lu Nothing has been decided yet, mother.
Lady Wang I see… I-I am simply concerned that, were your stay here to be prolonged, perhaps you might fade before your duties are completed.
Lady Wang Complete your duties and return soon, so that the… agreement Jia Mu has so graciously made for us is fulfilled, hmm?
Jia Mu Indeed.
Jia Mu Lose not, forget not.
Jia Mu You are our family's one and only jade.
Jia Mu Dear Baoyu, our peerless treasure, tarry not overlong in this mundane world; leave when the time is right, and fulfill your worth.
Hong Lu …….
Hong Lu Okay, grandmother. Mother.
Episode: 7
Location: Daguanyuan - Dahuating Banquet Hall
I thought the Sinners were doomed to chew uncomfortably through this incredibly awkward meal, but Jia Mu and her retinue of Heishou left the banquet hall quite promptly after that exchange. It was as though they had no more reason to remain here.
Yi Sang It is odd, that they should inquire Hong Lu of his departure plans on the very welcoming of his return.
Ishmael Right…? One moment it appears like they really care about him, then…
Meursault The appearance of that 'care' for one's own child was also quite distinct and unusual compared to the typical display of emotional intimacy expressed in average households.
??? Hey, Baoyu.
That's when an unfamiliar, chipper voice hopped jovially into our conversation.
Xue Baochai Why didn’t you come see me first? I’ve been staying in the same building ever since you departed here, you know?
Hong Lu Aha, big sis Xue Baochai. It’s been so long.
Hong Lu You’ve come all the way to my welcome banquet to fill a seat? I appreciate that.
Xue Baochai Had I known that you’d be coming home today, Baoyu, I would’ve summoned everyone I could from my family to see you, too. Big bro Pan’s really been itching to know how you’ve been doing.
Jia Xichun ... Yeah, sure he was.
Xichun, who’d been sitting in complete silence for the entire banquet, muttered quietly to herself.
Xue Baochai Who else have you greeted since you arrived today, Baoyu?
Hong Lu My parents and Jia Mu.
Xue Baochai Really? So I’m your first, then?
She made a cheerful remark before leaning close up to his eye.
Xue Baochai Your jade is always so glimmering and pristine, Baoyu.
Xue Baochai Look, I made myself a necklace in the same color as your eye and wore it every single day to constantly remind myself of you. Well, do you see it?
Hong Lu Oh, you have. Thank you for remembering me.
Rodion Ahem, ahem. So… are you gonna introduce her to us, orrrr…?
Gregor Hey… Why couldn’t we just let that nice reunion play out? Man…
Rodya stepped forward, unable to stand the curiosity.
Hong Lu Oh, she's—
Xue Baochai Hi, I'm Baochai. Baochai of the Xue family. I have a very profound relationship with dear Baoyu here.
Rodion A very profound relationship?
Xue Baochai Hehe, he is my betrothed, and I to him. I'd say that's pretty profound, hmm?
Rodion & Heathcliff WHAAAT??!!

Rodion H-hey, you coulda at least given us a hint!
Hong Lu Mm... but I won't be married until I leave Limbus Company, though?
Hong Lu I just thought that it wasn't relevant enough to share.
Xue Baochai So… sorry about overhearing earlier, but you guys are Baoyu’s friends, right?
Xue Baochai I’ve been so, so curious to hear what kind of life Baoyu lived out there. Care to share some tales of your journey with me?
Ryoshu Don't have stories for kids. Shoo.
Xue Baochai Why? But I loooove stories about bloodshed!
Hong Lu Ah, one of big sister Baochai’s pastimes was curating creepy stories of urban legends.
Ryoshu Puff… then maybe I’ll share some.
Xue Baochai Wah~ What about everyone else? I love, love, love adventure stories.
Gregor Be careful what you wish for…
Don Quixote Ah... I beseech thee to find a seat, for I shall now regale thee with a tale in which an adventure of most wondrous valor unfolds; brace thyself, for this particularly olden and terrifying tale features a big, scary bear lurking in a cavern...
Jia Xichun Ha...!
Jia Xichun If you're finished with your meals, why don’t we all go back to our residences?
Xue Baochai You’re so angry again, Xichun. Last I heard, you lost much of your followers in a large battle, didn't you? I'm so sorry. I used more than three handkerchiefs wiping my tears away upon hearing that news.
Jia Xichun So the Xue family’s heard it too, huh.
Jia Xichun You’re not wrong. But… that's irrelevant to what I've brought to the Family Hierarch war.
Xue Baochai Always a big fan of your confidence, Xichun. It's a good look, you know?

Xue Baochai What’d she mean by you knifing people in the back?
Hong Lu Ha ha, I just had a small falling out with Xichun, that's all.
Xue Baochai Aha! Xichun must’ve been trying to get you on her side, huh?
Xue Baochai Yeah, no wonder she wanted you on her team. Baoyu’s always excelled at whatever he does without stressing out or losing that happy smile...
Hong Lu It just kinda worked out that way~
Rodion I guess he can be a bit irritating like that, huh?
Faust … Such kind of people, though rare, indeed do exist.
Xue Baochai Oh! That reminds me, uh… um…
Xue Baochai Did you, by any chance, run into big brother Qi... Qiu?
Hong Lu I haven’t, but they have.
Xue Baochai T-that's good...
She placed her hand over her chest as though she'd just survived an incredibly dangerous accident, before eyeing us anxiously.
Xue Baochai So... what happened...?
Xue Baochai I do know that he was trying to ‘ally’ with Shi Yihua. I mean, it didn’t seem like anyone else was viewing that as an ‘alliance’ other than Shi Yihua himself, but…
It must’ve been a pretty open secret among the candidates that Jia Qiu was trying to ‘ally’ with Shi Yihua.
Hong Lu Mm… they cut big brother Yihua’s head off when he was with us.

Hong Lu …….
Ryoshu H.
